an10.24:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā mahācundo cetīsu viharati sahajātiyaṃ.
an10.24:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Mahācunda was staying in the land of the Cetīs at Sahajāti.

an10.24:1.2.pli: Tatra kho āyasmā mahācundo bhikkhū āmantesi:

an10.24:1.4.pli: “Āvuso”ti kho te bhikkhū āyasmato mahācundassa paccassosuṃ.

an10.24:2.1.eng: “Reverends, a mendicant who makes a declaration of knowledge says:

an10.24:2.2.eng: ‘I know this teaching, I see this teaching.’

an10.24:2.3.pli: Tañce, āvuso, bhikkhuṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati,
an10.24:2.3.eng: Suppose that greed masters that mendicant and keeps going.

an10.24:2.12.pli: pāpikā icchā abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati, so evamassa veditabbo:
an10.24:2.12.eng: or corrupt wishes master that mendicant and keep going. You should know of them:

an10.24:2.13.pli: ‘nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato lobho na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ lobho abhibhuyya tiṭṭhati;
an10.24:2.13.eng: ‘This venerable does not have the understanding that would eliminate greed, so greed masters them and keeps going.

an10.24:2.14.pli: nāyamāyasmā tathā pajānāti yathā pajānato doso na hoti …
an10.24:2.14.eng: They don’t have the understanding that would eliminate hate …

an10.24:2.22.pli: pāpikā icchā na hoti, tathāhimaṃ āyasmantaṃ pāpikā icchā abhibhuyya tiṭṭhatī’ti.
an10.24:2.22.eng: or corrupt wishes, so corrupt wishes master them and keep going.’

an10.24:5.1.pli: Seyyathāpi, āvuso, puriso daliddova samāno aḍḍhavādaṃ vadeyya, adhanova samāno dhanavāvādaṃ vadeyya, abhogova samāno bhogavāvādaṃ vadeyya.
an10.24:5.1.eng: Suppose a poor, needy, and penniless person was to declare themselves to be rich, affluent, and wealthy.

an10.24:5.2.pli: So kismiñcideva dhanakaraṇīye samuppanne na sakkuṇeyya upanīhātuṃ dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā.
an10.24:5.2.eng: But when it came time to make a payment they weren’t able to come up with any money, grain, silver, or gold.

an10.24:5.4.pli: ‘daliddova ayamāyasmā samāno aḍḍhavādaṃ vadeti, adhanova ayamāyasmā samāno dhanavāvādaṃ vadeti, abhogavāva ayamāyasmā samāno bhogavāvādaṃ vadeti.
an10.24:5.4.eng: ‘This person declares themselves to be rich, affluent, and wealthy, but they are in fact poor, penniless, and needy.’

an10.24:5.6.pli: Tathā hi ayamāyasmā kismiñcideva dhanakaraṇīye samuppanne na sakkoti upanīhātuṃ dhanaṃ vā dhaññaṃ vā rajataṃ vā jātarūpaṃ vā’ti.
an10.24:5.6.eng: Because when it came time to make a payment they weren’t able to come up with any money, grain, silver, or gold.

an10.25:1.1.eng: “Mendicants, there are these ten universal dimensions of meditation.

an10.25:1.3.pli: Pathavīkasiṇameko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ;
an10.25:1.3.eng: Someone perceives the meditation on universal earth above, below, across, undivided and limitless.

an10.25:1.4.eng: They perceive the meditation on universal water …

an10.25:1.12.pli: viññāṇakasiṇameko sañjānāti uddhaṃ adho tiriyaṃ advayaṃ appamāṇaṃ.
an10.25:1.12.eng: They perceive the meditation on universal consciousness above, below, across, undivided and limitless.

an10.25:1.13.eng: These are the ten universal dimensions of meditation.”

an10.26:1.1.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ āyasmā mahākaccāno avantīsu viharati kuraraghare pavatte pabbate.
an10.26:1.1.eng: At one time Venerable Mahākaccāna was staying in the land of the Avantis near Kuraraghara on Steep Mountain.

an10.26:1.2.pli: Atha kho kāḷī upāsikā kuraragharikā yenāyasmā mahākaccāno tenupasaṅkami; upasaṅkamitvā āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ abhivādetvā ekamantaṃ nisīdi. Ekamantaṃ nisinnā kho kāḷī upāsikā kuraragharikā āyasmantaṃ mahākaccānaṃ etadavoca:
an10.26:1.2.eng: Then the laywoman Kāḷī of Kurughara went up to Venerable Mahākaccāna, bowed, sat down to one side, and said to him,

an10.26:1.3.eng: “Sir, this was said by the Buddha in ‘The Maidens’ Questions’:

an10.26:2.1.eng: ‘I’ve reached the goal, peace of heart.

an10.26:2.2.eng: Having conquered the army <j>of the likable and pleasant,

an10.26:2.3.eng: alone, practicing absorption, I awakened to bliss.

an10.26:2.4.eng: That’s why I don’t get too close to people,

an10.26:2.5.eng: and no-one gets too close to me.’

an10.26:3.1.pli: Imassa kho, bhante, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa kathaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo”ti?
an10.26:3.1.eng: How should we see the detailed meaning of the Buddha’s brief statement?”

an10.26:4.1.eng: “Sister, some ascetics and brahmins regard the attainment of the meditation on universal earth to be the ultimate. Thinking ‘this is the goal’, they are reborn.

an10.26:4.2.pli: Yāvatā kho, bhagini, pathavīkasiṇasamāpattiparamatā, tadabhiññāsi bhagavā.
an10.26:4.2.eng: The Buddha directly knew the extent to which the attainment of the meditation on universal earth was the ultimate.

an10.26:4.3.pli: Tadabhiññāya bhagavā assādamaddasa ādīnavamaddasa nissaraṇamaddasa maggāmaggañāṇadassanamaddasa.
an10.26:4.3.eng: Directly knowing this he saw the beginning, the drawback, and the escape. And he saw the knowledge and vision of what is the path and what is not the path.

an10.26:4.4.pli: Tassa assādadassanahetu ādīnavadassanahetu nissaraṇadassanahetu maggāmaggañāṇadassanahetu atthassa patti hadayassa santi viditā hoti.
an10.26:4.4.eng: Because he saw the beginning, the drawback, and the escape, and he saw the knowledge and vision of what is the path and what is not the path, he knew that he had reached the goal, peace of heart.

an10.26:5.1.eng: Some ascetics and brahmins regard the attainment of the meditation on universal water to be the ultimate. Thinking ‘this is the goal’, they are reborn. …

an10.26:5.2.eng: Some ascetics and brahmins regard the attainment of the meditation on universal fire …

an10.26:5.9.pli: viññāṇakasiṇasamāpattiparamā kho, bhagini, eke samaṇabrāhmaṇā ‘attho’ti abhinibbattesuṃ.
an10.26:5.9.eng: universal consciousness to be the ultimate. Thinking ‘this is the goal’, they are reborn.

an10.26:5.10.pli: Yāvatā kho, bhagini, viññāṇakasiṇasamāpattiparamatā, tadabhiññāsi bhagavā.
an10.26:5.10.eng: The Buddha directly knew the extent to which the attainment of the meditation on universal consciousness was the ultimate.

an10.26:5.11.pli: Tadabhiññāya bhagavā assādamaddasa … ādīnavamaddasa … nissaraṇamaddasa … maggāmaggañāṇadassanamaddasa …
an10.26:5.11.eng: Directly knowing this he saw the beginning, the drawback, and the escape. And he saw the knowledge and vision of what is the path and what is not the path.

an10.26:5.12.pli: tassa assādadassanahetu ādīnavadassanahetu nissaraṇadassanahetu maggāmaggañāṇadassanahetu atthassa patti hadayassa santi viditā hoti.
an10.26:5.12.eng: Because he saw the beginning, the drawback, and the escape, and he saw the knowledge and vision of what is the path and what is not the path, he knew that he had reached the goal, peace of heart.

an10.26:5.13.pli: Iti kho, bhagini, yaṃ taṃ vuttaṃ bhagavatā kumāripañhesu:
an10.26:5.13.eng: So, sister, that’s how to understand the detailed meaning of what the Buddha said in brief in ‘The Maiden’s Questions’:

an10.26:6.1.eng: ‘I’ve reached the goal, peace of heart.

an10.26:6.2.eng: Having conquered the army <j>of the likable and pleasant,

an10.26:6.3.eng: alone, practicing absorption, I awakened to bliss.

an10.26:6.4.eng: That’s why I don’t get too close to people,

an10.26:6.5.eng: and no-one gets too close to me.’”

an10.26:7.1.pli: Imassa kho, bhagini, bhagavatā saṅkhittena bhāsitassa evaṃ vitthārena attho daṭṭhabbo”ti.

an10.267-746:1.16.eng: for the complete understanding of negligence …

an10.267-746:1.25.eng: these ten things should be developed.”

an10.267-746:1.28.eng: The Book of the Tens is finished.
